channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-1181] Libraries in profile cause container deployment to fail
item.description:
Adding the following library configuration to example-camel-sap profile causes deployment of child 'sap' container to fail:

lib.sapjco3.jar = file:///Users/wcollins/Dev/sapjco3-darwinintel64-3.0.8/sapjco3.jar
lib.libsapjco3.jnilib = file:///Users/wcollins/Dev/sapjco3-darwinintel64-3.0.8/libsapjco3.jnilib

The following exception is observed in child 'sap' container log:

2014-02-10 16:26:07,844 | ERROR | pool-36-thread-1 | ConfigInjection | .api.scr.support.ConfigInjection 51 | 59 - io.fabric8.fabric-api - 1.0.0.redhat-328 | Failed to inject configuration

{service.pid=io.fabric8.datastore, type=caching-git, component.name=io.fabric8.datastore, component.id=34, gitPullPeriod=1000}

item.summary: Libraries in profile cause container deployment to fail

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: On inspection this particular bug looks to be fixed in latest build (343). Still, the container spins up numerous threads and eventually crashes due to FABRIC-866 so I can't fully verify it works...

Retested this with jboss-fuse-6.1.0.redhat-352 and sap container is still failing to deploy. Please see attached log file for container.

Step to reproduce:
1. Edit example-camel-sap profile and add lib deployment properties:
lib.sapjco3.jar=http://localhost/~wcollins/sapjco3.jar
lib.sapjco3.jnilib=http://localhost/~wcollins/libsapjco3.jnilib
2. Create sap child container using example-camel-sap profile
3. Observe sap container get stuck in restarting state, temp files for libraries are continuously being deployed to lib folder of container.
Looks like file URIs are not handled properly for these profile libs. Should probably fix this for GA but the workaround for now is to use a "mvn" URI for downloading the lib.

Unfortunately I do not think using a mvn URI is an option for the native library. Deploying the native lib to a maven repo will mangle its name with maven coordinate info. This will prevent the sapjco3.jar from being able to load the native lib since the expected file-name for the native lib is hard-coded into the sapjco3.jar.
Too late for the ER3 productization build but I can try and get you a patched JAR off of -352 for Thursday demo.
Thanks Jonathan but I already have a work around for Thursday demo. I am more concerned with getting this fixed for the release. Thx

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
• create child container provisioned with following profile:

Profile:example-camel-sap 1.0 L:1 C:1
attribute.parents = feature-camel
#Profile:example-camel-sap
feature.camel-example-sap=camel-example-sap
config.org.osgi.framework.system.packages.extra=org.apache.karaf.branding,com.sun.xml.bind.v2.model.core,com.sap.conn.jco,com.sap.conn.jco.ext,com.sap.conn.jco.monitor,com.sap.conn.jco.rt,com.sap.conn.jco.server
repository.mvn\:org.fusesource.sap.example_camel-example-sap_1.0.0-SNAPSHOT_xml_features=mvn\:org.fusesource.sap.example/camel-example-sap/1.0.0-SNAPSHOT/xml/features
lib.sapjco3.jar = file:///Users/wcollins/Dev/sapjco3-darwinintel64-3.0.8/sapjco3.jar
lib.libsapjco3.jnilib = file:///Users/wcollins/Dev/sapjco3-darwinintel64-3.0.8/libsapjco3.jnilib
